intro: Gomphia nitida, commonly known as the smooth gomphia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
